channel.title: Error! ~PLEASE HELP~
channel.description: I got this webclient error. [code]load: class client.class not found. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.io.IOException: open HTTP connection failed: http://(FORUMS)/client/class.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.getBytes(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) ... 7 more Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class[/code]

item.title: Error! ~PLEASE HELP~
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

ry60003333:

Oh, then in that case, try pasting the URL it says isn’t loading into your browser and see if it loads. If it doesn’t, then the problem is the URL is bad.

I did but then it went to the forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Error! ~PLEASE HELP~
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Oh, then in that case, try pasting the URL it says isn’t loading into your browser and see if it loads. If it doesn’t, then the problem is the URL is bad.

gangsta tony:

lol, the forums URL was in the error but when I posted it here I took it out and put (FORUMS) because I thought it would be considered advertising I guess…

Yes it would be.

Read full topic

item.title: Error! ~PLEASE HELP~
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:3, topic:342819”]Whatever tutorial you are doing, you did a horrible job of reading it. Look at the exception that caused the problem:

Caused by: java.io.IOException: open HTTP connection failed: http://(FORUMS)/client/class.class

http://(FORUMS)/client/class.class is not a valid link. I’m assuming the tutorial wanted you to put the URL to your forums in the (FORUMS) area, which you did not do.[/quote]

lol, the forums URL was in the error but when I posted it here I took it out and put (FORUMS) because I thought it would be considered advertising I guess…

Read full topic

item.title: Error! ~PLEASE HELP~
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Whatever tutorial you are doing, you did a horrible job of reading it. Look at the exception that caused the problem:

Caused by: java.io.IOException: open HTTP connection failed: http://(FORUMS)/client/class.class

http://(FORUMS)/client/class.class is not a valid link. I’m assuming the tutorial wanted you to put the URL to your forums in the (FORUMS) area, which you did not do.

Read full topic
